snippet: The Association of State Correctional Administrators said in a statement Wednesday that the policy of keeping inmates in solitary confinement needed to be limited or ended.
abstract: Association of State Correctional Administrators, leading organization for jail administrators in United States, calls for limitations on, or for even ending, extended use of solitary confinement; statement, coming after Pres Obama ordered Justice Department to examine practice in federal prisons, points to changing views across US; effort may face pushback from prison guards, who view practice as necessary for maintaining safety.
lead_paragraph: The Association of State Correctional Administrators said in a statement Wednesday that the policy of keeping inmates in solitary confinement needed to be limited or ended.

headline.main: Prison Officials Join Movement to Curb Solitary Confinement
headline.print_headline: Prison Officials Join Movement to Curb Solitary
